Plotting and tidying radf objects

Source: R/autoplot-radf.R
autoplot.radf.Rd

autoplot.radf takes an radf object and returns a faceted ggplot object. shade

# S3 method for radf
autoplot(
  object,
  cv = NULL,
  include_rejected = FALSE,
  select_series = NULL,
  option = c("gsadf", "sadf"),
  shade_opt = shade(),
  include = "DEPRECATED",
  select = "DEPRECATED",
  ...
)

shade(min_duration = NULL, fill = "grey70", opacity = 0.5, ...)

Arguments

object

An object of class radf().
cv

An object of class "cv". The output of mc_cv(), wb_cv() or sb_cv()
include_rejected

If not FALSE, plot all variables regardless of rejecting the NULL at the 5 percent significance level.
select_series

If not NULL, only plot with names or column number matching this regular expression will be executed.
option

Whether to apply the "gsadf" or "sadf" methodology. Default is "gsadf".
shade_opt

options for the shading of the graph, usually used through shade functions.
include

argument name is deprecated and substituted with include_rejected.
select

argument name is deprecated and substituted with select_series.
...

further arguments passed to ggplot2::facet_wrap and ggplot2::geom_rect for shade.
min_duration

the minimum duration.
fill

the shade color that indicates the exuberance periods.
opacity

the opacity of the shade color aka alpha.

Examples

rsim_data <- radf(sim_data)

autoplot(rsim_data)

# Modify facet_wrap options through ellipsis
autoplot(rsim_data, scales = "free", direction  = "v")
#> Error in facet_wrap(~id, ...): unused argument (direction = "v")

autoplot(rsim_data, shade_opt = shade(shade_color = "pink", opacity = 0.3))
#> Warning: Ignoring unknown parameters: shade_colour

# Change (overwrite) color, size or linetype
autoplot(rsim_data) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("black", "black")) +
  scale_size_manual(values = c(1.2, 1)) +
  scale_linetype_manual(values = c("solid", "solid"))
#> Error in scale_color_manual(values = c("black", "black")): could not find function "scale_color_manual"

# Change names through ellipsis
custom_labels <- c("psy1" = "new_name_for_psy1", "psy2" = "new_name_for_psy2")
autoplot(rsim_data, labeller = labeller(id = as_labeller(custom_labels)))
#> Error in labeller(id = as_labeller(custom_labels)): could not find function "labeller"

# Change Theme options
autoplot(rsim_data) +
  theme(legend.position = "right")
#> Error in theme(legend.position = "right"): could not find function "theme"
